name: NSScriptClassDescription
desc: A scriptable class that a macOS app supports.

items.name: init?(suiteName: String, className: String, dictionary: [AnyHashable : Any]?)
items.desc: Initializes and returns a newly allocated instance of NSScriptClassDescription.

items.name: init?(for: AnyClass)
items.desc: Returns the class description for the specified class or, if it is not scriptable, for the first superclass that is.

items.name: func forKey(String) -> NSScriptClassDescription?
items.desc: Returns the class description instance for the class type of the specified attribute or relationship.

items.name: var superclass: NSScriptClassDescription?
items.desc: Returns the class description instance for the superclass of the receiver’s class.

items.name: var className: String?
items.desc: Returns the name of the class the receiver describes, as provided at initialization time.

items.name: var defaultSubcontainerAttributeKey: String?
items.desc: Returns the value of the DefaultSubcontainerAttribute entry of the class dictionary from which the receiver was instantiated.

items.name: var implementationClassName: String?
items.desc: Returns the name of the Objective-C class instantiated to implement the scripting class.

items.name: func isLocationRequiredToCreate(forKey: String) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether an insertion location must be specified when creating a new object in the specified to-many relationship of the receiver.

items.name: var suiteName: String?
items.desc: Returns the name of the receiver’s suite.

items.name: var appleEventCode: FourCharCode
items.desc: Returns the Apple event code associated with the receiver’s class.

items.name: func appleEventCode(forKey: String) -> FourCharCode
items.desc: Returns the Apple event code for the specified attribute or relationship in the receiver.

items.name: func matchesAppleEventCode(FourCharCode) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether a primary or secondary Apple event code in the receiver matches the passed code.

items.name: func hasOrderedToManyRelationship(forKey: String) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the described class has an ordered to-many relationship identified by the specified key.

items.name: func hasProperty(forKey: String) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the described class has a property identified by the specified key.

items.name: func hasReadableProperty(forKey: String) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the described class has a readable property identified by the specified key.

items.name: func hasWritableProperty(forKey: String) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the described class has a writable property identified by the specified key.

items.name: func key(withAppleEventCode: FourCharCode) -> String?
items.desc: Given an Apple event code that identifies a property or element class, returns the key for the corresponding attribute, one-to-one relationship, or one-to-many relationship.

items.name: func type(forKey: String) -> String?
items.desc: Returns the name of the declared type of the attribute or relationship identified by the passed key.

items.name: func selector(forCommand: NSScriptCommandDescription) -> Selector?
items.desc: Returns the selector associated with the receiver for the specified command description.

items.name: func supportsCommand(NSScriptCommandDescription) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the receiver or any superclass supports the specified command.
